actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

S. 1170 (Sen. Cornyn):
        A bill to reauthorize and update the Project Safe Childhood program, and for other purposes.

        -- Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.


 S.Res. 397 (Sen. Coons):
        A resolution designating October 16, 2023, and October 16, 2024, as "World Food Day".

        -- Senate Committee on the Judiciary discharged by Unanimous Consent.

        -- Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 425 (Sen. Coons):
        A resolution expressing the support of the Senate for the designation of "Public Radio Music Day" and deep appreciation for the role of public radio music stations in serving listeners, musicians, and hundreds of communities in the United States.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 426 (Sen. Hoeven):
        A resolution designating November 4, 2023, as "National Bison Day".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

PN155:
        Jessica Looman, of Minnesota, to be Administrator of the Wage and Hour Division, Department of Labor

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 51 - 47. Record Vote Number: 264 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, debate 10/25/2023.


 PN980:
        Michael G. Whitaker, of Vermont, to be Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration for the term of five years

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 94 - 0. Record Vote Number: 262 


        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 98 - 0. Record Vote Number: 263
By unanimous consent, on the request of Mr. Whitehouse, at  6:59 p.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 10 a.m. tomorrow.
